main event: A bright, luminous, round object was observed flying over Galveston, Texas on 20th July 1949. The object appeared to stop at a 90° angle over Galveston and then disappeared into the west at a tremendous speed.
interesting points: The object was described as having the appearance of a large star, with bright luminous color.
It was flying at an extremely high rate of speed, and the observers did not notice any sound or odor.

At the time of the sighting, a small civilian aircraft was flying in a north-south direction approximately one mile west of the shoreline, but it never approached close enough for its details to be noted.
The weather conditions at the time of the sighting were described as a cloudless, intense blue sky with an estimated wind velocity of about 15 miles per hour.
The object was reported to have faded into the distance at tremendous speed, just a few seconds after being observed stopping at a 90° angle.
